meanings.definition: The act of removing or cutting off the nerve supply to a body part.
meanings.sent1: After the denervation, the patient's arm felt numb and weak.
meanings.sent2: The denervation of the leg was necessary to relieve the chronic pain.
meanings.sent3: The denervation of the tooth made it impossible for the dentist to perform the procedure.
meanings.sent4: Her denervation of the phone line left her disconnected from the world.
meanings.sent5: The denervation of the garden hose stopped the water flow completely.

meanings.definition: The process of rendering a nerve or muscle nonfunctional by cutting or blocking its nerve supply.
meanings.sent1: The denervation of the muscle caused it to lose its ability to contract.
meanings.sent2: Denervation of the nerve was a last resort to manage the chronic pain.
meanings.sent3: The denervation of the TV remote made changing channels a challenge.
meanings.sent4: His denervation of the computer mouse made navigating the screen impossible.
meanings.sent5: The denervation of the car engine left it unable to start.
